A 45-year-old male presents to the clinic with a complaint of lower back pain for 3 months. The pain is radiating to the right leg with numbness up to his foot. Pain is continuous, and bowel and bladder functions are intact. He has a history of hypertension for the past 14 years. On examination, the right straight leg raise test is 60 degrees, and the left is 90 degrees. Sciatic nerve stretch is negative, right piriformis test is positive, and Faber test is negative. Reflexes and myotomes are intact with dermatomes, and the heel and toe walk test are normal. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
A 3-year-old child with spastic diplegic cerebral palsy has spastic bilateral hamstrings. Which one of the following is the most likely cause?

A 5-year-old boy presented with the complaint of bending of his trunk as noticed by his parents for 2 years. On radiological evaluation, a thoracolumbar curve was found out to be 11 degrees. Which of the following is the most appropriate management option for this patient?

answers.option: Plan surgery if curve progress to > 20 degrees before skeletal maturity
Clinical and radiographic followup every 1-2 years till skeletal maturity
Orthotic intervention of curve progress to > 1 degree during interval follow up

question: Which of the following statements defines an orthosis?
